name: Gias Uddin 0001
content: Gias Uddin | Associate Professor, York University Associate Professor, York University Lassonde School of Engineering, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Adjunct Professor at University of Calgary. Email: guddin AT yorku DOT ca Past/Present Employment Associate Professor, York University (2023 – Present) Assistant Professor, University of Calgary (2020 – 2023). Senior Data Scientist, Bank of Canada (2018 – 2020) Data Scientist, Apption Inc, Canada (2016 – 2018) Researcher & Machine Learning Software Developer, IBM Canada (2011 – 2015) Education PhD 2018, McGill University MSc 2008, Queen’s University BSc 2004, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology My research lies at the intersection of software engineering (SE) and artificial intelligence (AI). I am focused on the assessment of AI trustworthiness using SE (SE4AI) and on improving the productivity of software and knowledge professionals using AI enabled software assistants (e.g., AI4SE). I am the founding director of the Data Intensive Software Analytics (DISA) Lab. Prospective Students I am always looking for motivated and hard- working students. The student should have strong background in software engineering, machine learning, and human-computer interaction. NOTE: at this moment, I am only accepting PhD students. Any email/request for master’s admission won’t be reviewed. For a PhD admission at a Canadian research university like York or UCalgary, you would need to have master’s completed or you would need to be in the process of completion of your master’s degree.
